text: My new favorite hole in the wall Italian restaurant. Initially I was a little disappointed with the bread which was cold and seemed purchased from another store but soon the meal easily made up for it. I had a Capellini Mare e Monti which was a seafood combo. The portion was the perfect size and the delicious sauce well complemented the fresh seafood. The final selling point was the marvelous Tiramisu. Beautifully decorated and rich it was a pleasant desert to top off the evening. Cozy restaurant and friendly staff will be retuning soon.

I was here with a group of six women for a dinner meeting. I was excited because I don't get to North Beach as often as I'd like and was anxious for some real Italian food. I had a tough time parking and was a little late to our 6:30 p.m. reservation but the other 5 girls were there. I called my friend to let her know I was walking and she said that they were already being pressured to hurry. I hastened my walk a bit and got there around 6:45 or so. We ordered pretty quickly- I got the gnocci with gorgonzola which is a richer meal than I would usually order but when in rome eh? My companions ordered a variety of other items each of which looked delicious. Our food arrived relatively quickly which we appreciated. My gnocchi was good but not the best I have ever had and I wish there had been a little more of it. I did not appreciate however feeling rushed eating my food. We were meeting while we ate which of course slows the food consumption process but we all felt really pressured to eat faster. We were offered dessert which a few ordered and AS SOON as we were finished we were asked to finish up. They told us they had a reservation for 7:30 (this was at 7:50 by the way) and we needed to vacate. I pointed out the time to the server and she said "I know that's why we need you to leave". SAY WHAAAAAAT?!? I have never been asked to vacate a table for another party in my entire dining career. I was stunned. All of us were having a David After Dentist moment- "is this real life?". We vacated after paying the $230 tab (yep $230 for SIX PEOPLE) and moved our meeting outside. We had business to finish and so we stood out front for about 30 more minutes in order to do so. The overall opinion was that the food was good but none of us would rush back because of the service. It's unfortunate because I was so hopeful about the delicious delicious meal I was to have.

I don't write reviews often unless I feel the compelling need to let my annoyances or pleasure out about a place. Crap service. First time trying Italian food in San Fran. Basically what happened was that not only did they not pay attention that we waited 30 minutes for a seat but also let other people sit before us when we were there first and waited longer. I understand accidents happen but if it wasn't for the snarky or arrogant comment earlier + the mission to find parking on a Sat night in the area it might've been ok. Food wasn't amazing either it was just not bad to good. Heres what happened. I show up with my lady friend to tell them we need seats for 2 people. And the lady who works said ok great it'll be about 20 to 30 minutes. She didn't ask for a name or write anything about us and there were people there waiting before us already. Wondering how they will accurately keep track of their queue I asked her immediately after that if she needed to write my name down or how will she know who is next and what not. She replied by saying "we've been in business here for over 25 years we know who's next." 30 min later.. All the people who were there before us gets seated and now its about our turn... except that didn't happen... We were totally ignored and had another lady acknowledge that the other parties (came after us) will be seated shortly... at the same time she was seating another that came after us. At this point we already expected this. So we go to the entrance to ask her politely when are we going to be seated or what place in line are we? She said "you guys are last we'll be ready in 20 to 30 min." At that point i said sorry but we've been here for 30 min now and you just seated people that came after us shouldn't we be next? She replied sorry about that but we let them seat already. She didn't even verify that we'll be next. I started muttering "fuck i knew this shit would happen to my friend and saying we both knew". She said sorry again. You can imagine how annoyed I was especially after trying to verify how will they keep track of the patrons order of wait-list. The other party was kind enough to talk to her and let her know that we were indeed there first and waiting. So until then she came up to us and said "you guys want to be seated?" Rude. But whatever i'm giving them a try because of Yelp. In the end because of the experience arrogance service and lack of quality food. I will not be coming here ever again. PS: the complementary bread is shitty too.

A very lovely setting. Pastel blue tables lots of "Italian" paintings/items and clean plates/silverware. The staff was very patient in letting us decide what to order since we had no idea what the fancy terms meant haha. I got homemade pesto linguini with chicken. Very fresh noodles - thick and not soggy. Pesto was creamy and just right in taste. At first I thought there wasn't a lot of chicken but they're randomly placed throughout the noodles. Chicken is super juicy and fresh unlike some of the wet meat I've tried at other places. My friend got the seafood risotto. Very cheesy and delicious. Seafood was bouncy? Idk the texture was nice. Portion size is pretty large unlike some of the pictures I saw. We both couldn't finish. Also we had the bruschetta for the appetizer. The bread that comes with dinner is pretty dry and tasteless(although the olive oil and vinegar is bomb.com) so we thought the same of the bruschetta. To our surprise it was perfectly toasted and soft in the middle and seasoned superbly. A great way to start dinner! For dessert we got the Tartufa and Tiramisu. The Tartufa is a rich chocolate gelato with hazelnut/vanilla in the middle. Really creamy and full in flavor. Works perfectly with the heavy amount of cocoa powder. Everyone likes the Tiramisu so we tried it and it was alright. Creamy and soft. The bottom breaking is drenched in coffee so it's very soggy. Not too sweet. Our meal was $70.96 which is pretty pricy for two people.

Awesome authentic Italian restaurant owned by a family. Very cute and cozy. Everything was really delicious. We ordered chicken parmigiana with pasta on the side definitely a must try. Tortellini soup had enough flavour wasn't too salty again great overall. We also ordered their homemade tiramisu for me personally the cream on it was a delight. Nice friendly service. The restaurant was packed so if recommend making a reservation.

My second time here and definitely not my last! By far the best Italian food in SF! The owners treat all customers like family and I can say with confidence that everything on the menu is amazing! I love the lasagna and their ravioli. For dessert the cannoli is the way to go!
Best mom & pop italian in sf! Walk right by the stinking rose & go here. Ask what ravioli the lady of the house made that day & order it!

Either the quality has gone down or my taste buds have higher expectations than the last time I was here (about 2 years ago). Now that SF has so many delicious Italian choices where the pasta is made in-house/homemade it was tough for me to eat the store-bought pasta at Francino. The pasta lacked texture and flavor and even the best sauce couldn't change my disappointment. The gnocchi tasted better but I just couldn't get over how cheap the pasta tasted. I discovered another spot in North Beach called BaoNecci and I was really impressed with their pasta so that's my new go-to spot.

I've really gotta give this place five stars... As an Italian-American girl in SF from Jersey... I have to say this place has exceeded expectations twice now. A family run joint with a kitschy atmosphere Franchino really does hit the mark. I've always had an aversion to ordering pasta out at restaurants but each dish I've tried was just excellent. Simple flavors done well - exactly what I look for in a great Italian restaurant The first time I went I had the gnocchi with gorgonzola - I was wary as two heavy flavors can sometimes be too rich but somehow it was balanced light and not overly filling. An absolutely excellent dish. Their daily pasta specials have always been fresh with a very simple but flavorful ragu sauce that complemented my chicken piccata (seriously another homestyle classic done just right) incredibly well. Throw in a great dessert selection a decent array of wines and an intimate yet casual atmosphere - I will keep coming back and recommending this to locals and tourists alike. Oh and the family the runs it couldn't be friendlier - the owner even offered to help call cabs for the large out of town group we were with. Great little gem. PS - Our large group was talked into an appetizer sampler this evening and while everything was certainly tasty the roasted eggplant rolls with gorgonzola were simply to die for. Our whole table could not stop talking about it.

I love this restaurant to death. My friend and I ended up here after The House told us there was an hour wait. Ain't nobody got time for that! Yelp guided us to better. So far my favorite Italian restaurant it's too bad I live in LA. We were seated right away. But do beware seats get filled up quickly as well. We got lucky with timing. The interiors super cute classy but comfortable with a welcoming feel. Good to come with family or date. They have a wide variety of wines to select from. I ordered the eggplant Parmesan with a side of veggies to go with something on the lighter side. First time I've ever ordered eggplant Parmesan anywhere but it was delicious. It's not like a thick slab of eggplant with cheese but it seemed more like very thin multiple layers condensed together. And the cheese was perfectly melted nicely balanced ratio. My actual favorite part were the grilled veggies. They were cooked and seasoned to perfection. Not burnt or soggy or dry or bland or salty. Just perfect. The service was awesome. Servers came by to assist with recommendations and fill our water cups frequently. Making sure everything was good. Definitely will be coming back my next sf visit.

Nice Little family owned restaurant. Nicer than your average hole in the wall. Love eating down in this area when I take the family to san fran. Wish I could remember what the wife had but it was excellent. I had the veal saltimbocca tender and perfect. My daughter "the vegetarian" couldn't find anything that she liked so the server talked to the chef and they made her something special it was also huge and delicious. Deserts were perfect we had the marvelous Tiramisu and a second desert which was also great. Chef came to our table and chatted with us and checked on our daughters dinner. Have to say that I agree with every one else the bread is lacking. A lot of people are complaining about the service. Don't go expecting a 5 star restaurant its not. It is a well run little family place with great attention to their food quality.

- food: mediocre store-bought pasta - atmosphere: tiny cozy and loud - staff: inattentive forgetful - price: overpriced additional info: - their stale bread seems to be indicative of the overall quality and laziness of this restaurant
My bad. The "random" guy on the sidewalk is the restaurants namesake. Interesting. And the food is great. Treated like family small intimate setting that's grey for talking and laughing. Nice.

There is that one restaurant that you talk about and reminisce fondly over once you return home from vacation. Franchino's was THAT place for my husband and I. You can't find a more authentic Italian restaurant! Franchino the owner and his wife and daughters made our evening so special. The food was amazing...we had the delicious gnocchi and spaghetti with Italian sausage. We also had the best Tiramisu I have ever tasted in my life. It is definitely a special place that I hope to return to again in the future.

This is my wife's and my first time in San Francisco and our first dining experience at Long Beach (do not call it Little Italy - sensitive New Yorkers). We hopped out of our cab and gravitated towards Franchino - and we weren't disappointed. Top notch recommendations for food and vino with a sorely missed family atmosphere. Highly highly recommended...buena serra Franchino - we will definitely be back!

Ugh since when did this place get so popular!? Great for business for this mom and pop place except the tourists are super rude and snotty. Tourists were telling people to go to the end of the line even though they had a reservation. I don't care which country you're from but I would've allowed people to check in with the waiter ESPECIALLY if they had a reservation. Just because you've been waiting in line in the cold doesn't give you the right to be rude to people. GO HOME. Anyway try the prosciutto appetizer and gnocchi! Best I've ever had and I always order this. Most recently I had a layered cake which is to die for! The services were great as always. The family staff are always so kind funny and they are so cute together!

Seeing as there are endless places to get good Italian food in little Italy it can be hard to decide where to go. We chose Franchino because the menu looked good and the wait was short. And we lucked out - this place was awesome! It's a total mom and pop kinda place. I got the feeling that everyone working there was family and I even heard some Italian so you know it's gonna be good. My boyfriend and I decided to split a couple things. We got a Caesar salad and the special - a homemade pasta with a meat ragu. The salad was great - just the right size for two and the dressing was flavorful without being overpowering. It also had big slices of fresh parmesan which is always good. The pasta was delicious. The noodles (fettuccini style) were cooked perfectly the meat sauce was good and chunky lots of tender flavorful meat. I'm not always a big fan of tomato-based sauces but this was an exception. It was a sop it up with bread kinda sauce for sure. The service was friendly the atmosphere was homey and the food was fantastic. A good choice for sure!

Pretty crazy to read the polar opposite reviews. I sat with a group of 9 we were treated like family and the ladies working were hospitable and truly Italian. The food was pretty damn authentic and tasted great. I had spaghetti carbonara and it was tasty. My wife had salmon risotto which was even better. Would definitely go back
The service was good and the people are so nice but this is over-priced and nothing special. It's typical "Little Italy" fare.

We have had dinner here twice. The most recent was last weekend. Both times our dinner has been excellent. The family is very friendly and made us feel welcome. We were seated right away. We received water and bread along with olive oil and vinegar. We placed our order which arrived within a very short time. Our group of five had several pastas and all were very good hot down to the bottom of the plate. There was nothing left on any of the plates. We have not been disappointed on either occasion. We will definitely be back.

We stumbled into Columbus Ave on our first day in S.F. This family-owned place is excellent. My boyfriend's chicken saltimboca was really good. I had a pasta with marinara. It was perfect. The place is small and we were lucky to find a table.

Absolutely a wonderful experience. The caprese salad and house salads were a great start. My wife and I had 2 different veal dishes (mustard and saltimbucco). Both excellent! Followed our meal with delicious limoncello custard. Very friendly and efficient service with a great atmosphere. Will definitely be back.

We had a good meal but it was overshadowed by the attitude of the hostess/owner/waitress. Very rude. All about her needs. No regard for allowing the customer to enjoy the experience. If she wants to turn tables so quickly maybe she should say that upon booking reservation. Rushed from the get go. 1 hour 20 minutes on a $200+ tab is ridiculous. Then you TELL us to leave? How about you try booking your reservations 90 minutes apart and not 60 minutes apart. Don't go here if you are hoping to relax and enjoy an evening out. There are lots of other choices.

Awesome restaurant. Easily the most authentic in Little Italy. not the biggest or showiest - but this is where you come if you want amazing authentic Italian cooked by Nonna ! Book way ahead or walk in but be prepared to wait 20-30mins on busy nights - but worth the wait. The Gamberi was awesome
Yummy Italian food at an authentic family owned joint. We need a place like this in Palo Alto!

Amazing food. The mom Carmela and the dad were wonderful hosts. Felt like being an Italian home such warmth and comfort. Small dining area but wonderful atmosphere. We got the eggplant parm prawns steak and fettuccini Alfredo... All were incredible. To add to it "Mom" (the owner) suggested a chianti that wasn't on the wine list--it was incredible!!! Would suggest to all and can't wait to go back!!!

Dinnertime hungry walking around North Beach. There are so many choices so I feel lucky that I found this place and that they had a table available. It is a very small place and was very busy. This turned into one of the best Italian meals I have ever had. I had the Chicken Porcini and the chicken was melt-in-your-mouth perfectly cooked. This is a real family run place with real home-cooked food.

Adorable place ran by an Italian family. The husband sits outside and chats with everyone walking by. Their food was amazing! The pink sauce was delicious and the wife makes the pasta each morning. The noodles were so fresh that it melted in your mouth. I will be back!

I have been craving authentic homey Italian in a hole-in-the-wall place like this since moving to the Bay Area and we just happened in last night with friends - our four-top was seated without a wait but I think we got lucky with our timing. This place is the real deal - as authentic as you can get on the West Coast and outside of Italy. Simple expertly prepared casual fare dressed up enough to feel like Sunday Supper. Family-owned for twenty-five years Franchino is comprised of a husband and wife team featuring any one of their three daughters ("The SHORT One The TALL One ..." Etc.). The trio serves up just the right amount of Old World charm you want in a place like this - great service pleasant and passionate about their food and if you're lucky the Mister will favor the joint with a duet usually alongside one of the more attractive female diners chosen at random. Tiny and cozy be prepared to wait if you haven't secured a table and not surprisingly wine is the order of the day as this place does not have a full liquor license -- but you won't miss that unless you're somehow not a fan of wine. I enjoyed the Veal Saltimbocca - succulent and perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of mozzarella and prosciutto. Alongside it I chose the pasta of the day which happened to be rigatoni -- my favorite!! - with meat sauce. The pasta was perfect al dente and the entire meal was so good it almost made me cry. You can't pass up dessert in a place like this - I went for a cannoli which they make in-house and oh my god - amazing!! So get in there already!!

We loved this place. Visiting the North Beach area for the first time this is exactly what I envisioned a local family run North Beach Italian restaurant would be like. All of the dishes we ordered were very good the risotto was excellent. Everything was home made and fresh. I would definitely return and highly recommend it.

Incredible service and food. We got the lasagna and chicken parmesan. They were both AMAZING! We left feeling full but not heavy. We got a table right away but I got the feeling that it's usually not the case. I'd recommend calling ahead or arriving early. Also they only seat you when everyone in your pretty has arrived.

Charming restaurant and lovely staff. I came for an early dinner at the Franchino's after finding the restaurant on Yelp. I'm in San Francisco on business and after a busy day wanted a relaxing venue with good food and drink. I wasn't to be disappointed. Eating alone not a problem and I was made to feel very welcome by the owners. Penne Ragu main course was excellent cooked well and very tasty. The Tiramisu I had for dessert was fantastic one of the best I have had in a long time. Attentive service a friendly chat with the owner - I will definitely be visiting again

I went here tonight with my husband and definitely wasn't wowed. For one thing don't believe that reservations mean anything here. We made a reservation for 7 and waited in line for 51 min. As a pregnant woman in my third trimester I garnered a lot of sympathy from the other people in line but we weren't even apologized to once by the staff here. I really didn't feel any 'family-owned' vibe. I just felt ignored and used for our money. The food was good but the bar is so high for Italian food in North Beach that this place didn't stand out. Honestly we picked this place because they supposedly took reservations and I didn't want to pass out while lined up on a smog-filled street but since they don't honor reservations we could have lined up and gone anywhere else. The unexpectedly long wait also resulted in an extra hour of a parking charge and missing out on another place we planned to visit after dinner. That might not be as big a deal if you live within walking distance but keep that in mind if you're not local.
My favorite Italian restaurant. This place has great food great vibe and will quickly win your heart. If you love fresh pasta fresh sausage garlic butter...this is your place.
Incredible food great atmosphere and super friendly family of staff. I can't think of any negatives. Every time I go to SF from now on ill pass by Franchino.

Everyone I bring here loves it as well for seven years running- last night we got there early and since things were slower ( but not for long!!) asked if we could have a drink while waiting for my husband to join us- no problem! Would never have asked when it's busy. We look at the menu but I wonder why because the key to me is just going with what Mama makes for the specials! (Especially the parpadelle- I wait holding my breath to hear there's parpadelle...) gnocchi and chicken piccata also excellent! Save room for dessert- I used to get the tiramisu (awesome) until I tried the panna cotta (amazing- get it unless it's the last piece- that one's mine!)

With so many choices in the area very few if any are as good as this one. Love eating at local family owned and operated and this one did not disappoint. Price is reasonable and service was friendly and fast. Excellent quality as well. Not a big bar selection but enough to satisfy. Will return next time in in San Francisco for sure.

Franchino's gets 1 star for faking it. I'm at a loss for words and almost lost my lunch after eating here on my birthday with my mother who was visiting from Brooklyn NY. Talk about adding insult to injury! The meal and overall experience was so bad it's actually funny. To start when we first walked in my down to earth but food-loving mother said "How come it doesn't smell like food in here...?" It was like the food had been microwaved and left to sit. The eggplant parmesan had the texture of an old shoe my husband's dish looked like something out of a slasher movie (he ate about 1 bite of the unidentifiable chicken with red stuff and cheese goo) the salad was dressed with something out of a bottle and the bread just bad. Who f**ks up bread!?! I believe what they say about bread being a litmus test for food and boy do I wish we'd honored this notion. Upon both entering and exiting the restaurant there was Franchino sitting outside drinking a beer (not even peroni) spouting out some things in Italian to patrons and passersby. What a gimmick! My mother gets 2 stars for giving an honest answer when he asked if we enjoyed dinner. "Actually it was pretty disappointing..." I was not surprised by her candidness but it definitely knocked Franchino's socks off. Hope you find this funny but heed my warning - 5 stars for gross!

Had a fabulous meal with fabulous service and entertainment from Italian guy (owner?) hovering outside the front door and interacting with customers. Servers were attentive. We tried a couple of the specials-of-the-day which were excellent. The bruschetta appetizer was mouth-watering good and the tiramisu renewed my interest in tiramisu. I will definitely go back!

Can't find a reason to take away a star so 5 it is. Prompt friendly great authentic Italian food (my husband is Italian). Gnocchi w/pesto very good seafood pasta great! Tiramisu we had to take home because we were full! Haven't enjoyed it yet but I am sure it's going to be great!

text: So my last review was for take out but we dined in this time I went again last night and I am regretting not taking home my leftovers- granted it was only a bite but I want that bite so bad right now. Amazing amazing meal! I got the special which was a rigatoni pasta with wild boar ragu style sauce. Omg I want it right now should I walk up there and get it? Maybe I will. We also started with the snails! I made my boyfriend try it they were awesome!

Recommended by some locals so I decided to cancel my existing reservation elsewhere. Firenze by Night is located pretty much right at the Chinatown and Little Italy border. It was more neighborly than touristy and a place frequented by celebrities as evidenced by all the autographed pictures on the wall. We sat and like most Little Italy trattorias the staff was purely Italian. We knocked out our drinks app and dinner order in one swoop. The prosciutto and melon was simply simply that. I can't say it was spectacular - just a combination of something salty and something sweet. The waiter allowed me to return my soda and alcohol drink that he suggested when I wasn't really enjoying it. I appreciated his levity. Ok no I've had many tortellini alfredos but this was just incredible. I found myself having each one in a whole bite. I soaked up some of the sauce with the complimentary breads. The vegetarian lasagna of which I never though I could savor was equally fantastic. Overall- good environment great food and fun service.

I dined at this Italian restaurant last Tuesday and had the snails and the rabbit pappardelle and shortly after became violently ill. We went to the theater after dinner and I spent the second half of the show in the bathroom. I missed a day of work and am still sick three days later. I have been a chef professionally for twenty years and I am confident that this is the source of my continuing illness. I called the restaurant to let them know that this occurred. I made it clear that I wanted nothing only to bring the situation to the attention of the chef or manager. I found the gentleman(manager) I spoke with to be argumentative and defensive. On a brighter note some of the dishes that we had were quite nice the gnocchi was excellent. The pappardelle pasta was the perfect texture. I just can't give it another star because of how sick I got.

5 stars. Really. This is the best Italian dining experience I have had in 10 years. I brought a party of 9. It is an old school white tablecloth restaurant. The waiter was impeccable. Obviously Italian is his first language. He described the dishes beautifully. We had snails and fresh mozzarella with tomatoes for appetizers. My party had lamb shank ravioli lasagna gnocchi (they are famous for the gnocchi) and he brought us each a small plate. Omg it was amazing. Light and fluffy not heavy at all. I had veal Marsala and it was the most tender I've ever had. 3 bottles of wine flowing beer and cocktails apps salads dinner and desert with espresso for 9 people for $700 including a 20% tip.

Went here with friends last night. They are regulars but it was our first visit. I will definitely be back. The food was DELICIOUS! The service impeccable. My husband and I both started with the spinach salad - its served with a warm dressing and was so yummy. The gnocchi was melt in your mouth delicious. I've tried a lot of gnocchi and it was definitely the best I've had. I like that the restaurant is family owned family run business. The staff who are all italian have worked there for years (i'm talking 20-25 years) They clearly take great pride in providing good service and helping you enjoy your evening!

This restaurant came highly recommend to me so without a doubt I had to go! Love the decor and the overall atmosphere of the place! I sat at the bar and the bartender was awesome! Started off with Prosecco which was perfect! Then to the caprese salad the pesto sauce and mozzarella where to die for. So I was told that I had to get gnocchi. Ugh if I had to hahaha. It came out on the huge plate with amazing cream sauce! It was TERRIFIC!!!!!! It was hot and hardy and full of flavor!!!! Great experience!!!! I will be going back!!!!! GRAZIE!!!

I don't know what's worse the decor the food the phony welcome at the door or the greasy long hair on the waitstaff. You can walk one block in either direction on Green Street and find better Italian food for less money. Read the reviews at the bottom of this page under "reviews not currently recommended" and see you if you still want to visit.

Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco. The real deal. From the moment you walk in the door you are treated like a superstar. I'll stop talking about the amazing service and focus on the food now. It's an absolute must that you order the mushroom stuff with sausage appetizer. From that point on my only advise it order whatever appeals to you when you read the menu. You really can't go wrong with any of their entrees.

text: Another great visit. The gnocchi and spinach salad were outstanding. PS - They were filming a commercial while we were there. That staff was very friendly and helpful about being us possibly being uncomfortable. Very good experience!
I've been coming here for years. Love all their food. They accommodated my party of 5 near closing and didn't rush us out. Excellent service and fantastic food.

Flavorful Italian food with a decent portion size. My husband had Gnocchi and I ordered Pollo Con Funghi. Gnocchi was tasty and a must try however the taste is only of the sauce the dumplings in itself have no taste whatsoever. if you want something crunchy(Veggies or meat) or saucy/spicy you may want to order something else as this is only dumplings in sauce. Pollocon Funghi was very very tasty. It has right level of spice and sauce. comes with a small portion of grilled veggies and cracked wheat . Everything served in this dish tastes mouth watering. Space is a little crammed but over all good ambience. Its gets crowded after 6:30PM on weekends so make sure to reserve a table else the wait can be for an hour. I recommend this place.

This is a small and cute italian restaurant located away from all the touristy places on Columbus. Great spot for a date or a dinner out with friends. Expect great authentic italian food and some buff italian waiters serving you does not hurt either :) We ordered one of the specials which was veal wrapped in beef served with vegetables. The meat was cooked in a red wine sauce and was very flavorful but I wasn't too impressed with the dish in general. The pappardelle toscana was excellent though! The pasta tasted like they made it fresh in their kitchen and the sauce tasted homemade as well. I like how there was just enough sauce to coat the noodles and it didn't overpower the whole dish.

Went here recently before catching the Beach Blanket Babylon show up the block. We just Yelp'd the place before showing up and it looked like it got good reviews so we decided to have dinner there. No line no wait immediate table at about 7pm that was definitely a plus! The place was busy but not every table was taken. For appetizers we had the tomato/mozz/basil thing and carpaccio. Both were very light and delicious! For our entree we had the Fettuccini buon guistao(sp) and the Parpadelle Tosca with rabbit sauce I love the wide noodles and the rabbit bits in the sauce made it tasty. Both were very tasty and freshly made. We definitely enjoyed our meals. Oh we had the pannacotta with fresh strawberries for dessert to share. Great way to end the meal. The ambiance/decor is a bit dated but it adds character service was pretty good our waiter seemed very serious so we were glad we didnt need much after we got our food. Very serious face and not much chatting at all I only saw him smile once when he was talking to the other waiters. All the waiters and staff seem to be actually Italian with accents and everything the owner seemed very nice with greeting people etc. A definite recommend good location near a lot of things to see/do nearby. If only we could remember where we parked. haha! For 2 of us with apps entrees few glasses of wine and dessert was just under $100. I was expecting to spend this amount but I wasnt dissappointed in our choice for dinner. Happy eating!

I'd like to give this place a BIG FAT ZERO!!!! Not knowing they opened at 5PM we had arrived at 4:30 PM looked at the store front menu and proceeded to walk in when a worker told us...not open till 5pm. OK. They wouldn't allow a party of five in for a drink or seat us to look more closely at the menu. So we walked for a few minutes and returned. It was 4:55 PM. The two workers were now 'BUSY' smoking in FRONT of the restaurant! We figured they wouldn't mind if we were five minutes early. Nope. They did NOT invite us in. They did not make us feel welcome at all!! What the hell is the big deal about guests arriving a few minutes early? Did we interrupt their smoke time? We said screw it. These guys are A-holes and we aren't going to waste another minute waiting for them!!! You would think in this economy they would welcome guests even a few minutes early. NEVER AGAIN for this place.
One of the worst italian food I have ever eaten. Worst tiramisu ever. The only thing I ate completely was the bruschetta.
Great food and authentic atmosphere Would get a 5 star if wine list had better choices. Worth the trip.

Firenze is the BEST Italian food in SF. It is all "home made" fresh! Sergio the owner and his son Paulo always make sure you have the best experience. Eating here is not only delicious it feels authentic warm inviting and fun! The Gnocchi is to die for! Ask for a shot of the home made Limonchello after your dinner.
Sergio by himself make the place! It's great to have fun while you are having superb Italian food.

There were so many good things on the menu my daughter and I ended up ordering 3 pasta dishes and taking home left overs. It was definitely worth it. Of course we had to have the award winning Gnocci Firenze and it was most excellent. The gnocchi was light and the sauce was just right. Will definitely get this again. We also had the Penne Allo Zenzero with sun dried tomatoes garlic and shallots. The spice was hot but not too hot. The flavors blended together very well. We also had the Cannelloni Biago which is crepes stuffed with prosciutto and chicken. Of the 3 this dish was not quite as good as the other 2 but maybe it's just our taste since this one didn't have as much flavor. The sauce was similar to the gnocchi sauce. For dessert we had to try their tiramisu and it was excellent. Creamy filling light cake layers and good coffee flavor. We also had the chocolate tartufo which was excellent as well. The staff was very attentive. Overall it was a great experience. Will definitely go back hopefully soon.

My husband and I came here to celebrate our 20th anniversary. The staff was warm and friendly. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the food and wine. I had the tortellini in brodo (soup) and award winning gnocchi firenze. The soup was delicious but the gnocchi was as they say in Italy fantastico! My husband had the penne allo zenzero which had the perfect amount of spice. This place was a delightful North Beach find!

We had such a delightful visit last night. Paolo treated us to a nice table by the window told us the story of how how his parents had opened the restaurant and how they still make pasta fresh daily. After appetizers we had the gnocci pappardelle and the Petto di pollo alla toscana. Our waiter made a great wine recommendation in our price range. They were very attentive and aware that we were heading over to Beach Blanket Babylon and made sure we were on our way in plenty of time. Can't wait to come back!
Super good food. Diamond in the rough worth finding. The risotto was crazy good and the gnocchi were perfect. Go here.

Had the special seafood with pasta in a tomato sauce! Delicious! Had calamari salad to start and the chicken dish with White wine and mushrooms!! Definitely worth the wait! Service was decent but it's because it's heavily packed! Recommend it for authentic Italian food!

Pros: -Short to no wait (all the other restaurants had an hour wait) -Average food (at the time we were starving and it tasted good take that hunger away and it's probably a few steps above Olive Garden food) Cons: -Service seemed untrained and lost -Decor seems like a nice Italian restaurant from the 90s Hungry and don't want to wait in line? That's why we came here recently. We were seated quickly but the table was dirty. The wait staff looked at our table again and asked us what the stain was. Wow. I can't believe you're asking me but that's pasta sauce. He looked at the tablecloth in sheer disbelief and said it was a clean tablecloth. He went on a little longer about how clean the cloth was and proceeded to run his hands over the stain. What I couldn't believe was how long he decided to spend with this cloth instead of acknowledging that it is dirty and simply removing it. No apology and no offer to move us to a clean table. We were later offered to have the wait staff replace the cloths but forget it. We're already seated let's just make the best out of this and move on. At this point we've ordered our food and were chatting with one another. Wait staff brings out bread while holding orders for other tables. He ends up spilling sauce all over my friend's jacket/back. - To be fair they were quick to apologize to him and tried to clean my friend up quickly with dry towels. Little bit of club soda would've been a nice touch to help get out any stains but dry towels was probably the best the employees could've done. Here is where they earn their 1 star. The food at Firenze was good - we devoured it so fast that I can't even remember what we ordered. I am just left with a thought of that was tasty...But you should probably also know we were starving. Overall if I was already in the area and did not want to wait for another restaurant I wouldn't mind giving Firenze another try. Maybe we were just unlucky that night and they'd do better next time? From what I saw wait staff seemed untrained and confused. This is probably due to poor management. I would suggest retraining the front of house staff and possibly hiring new manager(s).

One word AUTHENTIC! The ravioli sauce has a subtle yet noticeable taste of red wine and tiny pieces of beef. The bruschetta is made with the freshest tomatoes. I recommend getting a glass of their small selection of wines to accompany your meal. I'm a monthly visitor. I won't lie and say the service is terrific. On the contrary some of the waiters tend to be a little strange. By strange I mean inpatient and kind of rude at times. It's pretty loud at times! I recommend making a reservation!

Yes the gnocchi really are that good. Usually gnocchi leaves you feeling bloated and heavy due to all the cream and cheese but these were coated lightly in a tomato cream sauce that was perfectly proportioned. The salad I ordered was decent and wine was ok the real standout here was the praised and prized little pillows of heaven. My friend and I split the gnocchi and a salad and each had two glasses of wine-- paid about $40 each. Not the cheapest meal. Next time I will skip all the frill and order those gnocchi to go.

This is one of my favorite Italian restaurant in North Beach The service if excellent friendly helpful the decor is perfect and the food portions are large tasty and plated perfect clean.Everyone in are party always brings home leftovers I highly recommend this restaurant
The gnocchi and the Pappardelle are amazing!

HOLY F*CKING GNOCCHI Yes it has won awards - and yes it deserves to. Get the gnocchi and if you need some protein get it with the bolognese. Gotta love the authentic Italian staff as well - such charmers!

Great Service great atmosphere If you like Gnocchi...this is the right place to eat..best in the city. I just don't recommend the swordfish unless you like a rubbery charcoaled flat fish. Wine list met all expectations

I've had two things here; the Gnocchi Firenze and Pappardelle Tosca. Both delicious!!! The Gnocchi are larger and vary in size with the perfect consistently to them. They're in a tasty light tomato cream sauce with great seasoning. Ummmm they are so good!!!Possibly one of the best in the city. Pappardelle Tosca is prepared in a delicious rabbit sauce. The pappardelle noodles taste fresh too. The service is great especially if you're female. The Italian servers really live up to the flirty reputation of Italian men. Great ladies night out! But more importantly amazing Italian food! This is the first Italian restaurant I recommend in North Beach when people ask. Mangia bene!

Loooouuuve the food!! Whenever I visit an italian restaurant the first thing that comes to mind is the heavy greasy cheesy food. But here its just perfectly done. Satisfying the taste without leaving you feeling guilty. Being a vegetarian found enough good options on the menu. Must try this place.

Anything less than a five star review is just a hoax. Firenzes has the best Italian the best service and an all Italian staff. How could you go wrong? Pesto gnocchi is the best dish I've ever eaten. Boom. Go to firenzes.

rating: ;
text: I just finished my 2nd visit here. The first time was so fantastic and I was really looking forward to this meal. It just didn't hold up. My waiter seemed like he was having a bad day. The service was fine but he was surly and not one smile the whole service. The papradelle was good but not great. When my bill came I politely asked if they would call a cab for me. The waiter told me to walk down a block and hail one myself. Not what I was expecting and I don't think I will have to go back a 3rd time.
One of my new favorite place to dine in the city. Very pleased with the entire meal. Will be back. Thanks again Fabio.
Absolutely smashing ! Top notch food and service.

We wanted to have dinner in the North Beach area on our recent trip to San Francisco trying to find the charm of the place that we read so much about. I looked into lots of restaurants in the area I was looking for a place less touristy without a super cheesy decor w. more interesting food reasonable priced and more authentic. Firenze by Night seemed a good fit. We stopped by one evening for dinner and the place is cute cozy with some nice indoor lights. We were seated at a small table too close to the kitchen (noisy corner). I asked the host if we can be seated somewhere else and he said "no" they were waiting for bigger parties. We realized that this place is better for bigger parties not for couples out on a date or smaller groups. We weren't thrilled but stayed. Got some bread from the house (nothing great) that we dipped in olive oil and a couple of glasses of Chianti ($8 a glass). The waiters are Italians that's nice. I ordered the Tortellini Alla Romana (w. peas and prosciutto) and my husband got the Cannelloni Biagio (pasta stuffed w. chicken and prosciutto ricotta in a marinara sauce). The waiter told him that his dish would take longer to make (30 min.) since it's made from scratch. We were cool w. that. No rush we were on vacation. But they brought the food very fast too fast. So way less than 30 min maybe 10? The food was good but nothing outstanding. We skipped the dessert. The waiter was lingering too much around us but when my husband wanted to pay the check somehow the host picked it up. The host gave us the wrong change (less than was owed) when my husband went to ask him he was denying he took care of it. Then some manager (I guess) got involved the host came back with the explanation " these new bills stick together" and brought the actual change (more). The meal was the most expensive that we had while we were in San Francisco (this place is the only one that is more expensive than their online menus- with 2-3 dollars more for each item) and it was the least satisfying meal we had on our trip. It wasn't bad but we didn't enjoy it as much as we hoped. The place lacked atmosphere we didn't feel welcome and felt a bit hassled taken advantage of rushed out and didn't enjoy the "bill incident''. I wouldn't come back to this place!

The gnocchi is amazing here. I highly recommend you get it if it's your first time. It's served with a creamy tomato sauce that's halfway between marinara and alfredo. The servers were friendly and attentive. The decor is a bit cheesy and dated for the cost of the restaurant however.

We (three of us) had a delightful dinner at Firenze by Night. This was last evening following a Beach Blanket Babylon performance. We were seated at a small window table. The place was filled with people obviously enjoying themselves (the noise level can get loud). I had a wonderful Saltimbocca my wife and daughter shared a mixed seafood item. We remarked on how very good the food was. We had a bottle of Italian wine (previously had two cocktails from the bar). Desserts were complimentary (due to a BBB promo listed in their program). An all-Italian waiter staff (well not really our waiter proudly said he is from Sicily). We had an pleasant conversation with the owner when we left. And the amazing thing was the size of the bill very reasonable. We will be back sometime.

Stay away from the Parmesan!!!!! It completely ruined my Gnocchi...it tastes like the cheap pre-grated preservative-loaded crap you get in the little packets at Pizza Hut!!! The meal started out pleasantly enough; service was timely...until I finished my meal. My girlfriend was still eating but the waiter repeatedly asked if she was finished and tried to take her plate. If she stopped for so much as 10 seconds to talk with me the waiter would swoop in and try to take her plate. Very frustrating! Overall the food was a solid 4 stars (avoid the parmesan) and the service was about 2.5 stars. I would go back as long as I got a different waiter.

Top notch Italian restaurant in the Russian Hill/North Beach neighborhood. I had been here once before a long time ago (think I was only 14-15 years old) but I still remembered the place pretty well once we walked in. It is a one room restaurant with maybe enough space for 20 or so tables. There is a small bar near the front door and lots of window space. Even at 7:30 PM in the summertime there was quite a bit of natural light coming into the restaurant. To start I had a glass of Slovenian white wine which was not quite a pinot gris but pretty close. Semi-dry and smooth on the palate. My fiance had a Chianti and it tasted pretty great too. Their alcohol prices if you're splitting a bottle are better than what I've seen for similar restaurants in the DC area. We also ordered a side dish of warm olives which went pretty quickly. I had the spaghetti vongole (clams in a white wine sauce with capers). It was the perfect portion size and the clams were done well. Definitely one of those dishes where I wish there were seconds allowed! Although I wished their main entrees were a dollar or 2 less than advertised everything was cooked to order and we had no compliants. This is a great place for both visitors and locals to rub elbows and enjoy some great Italian comfort food.

The portion size I got last Sunday afternoon was literally only a quarter of what I see in these photos..... Carlesimo was disappointing. The texture was too dry and chewy I'm not sure if it was fully cooked. I really regret not asking them to recook it. Ravioli Beef was good but we finished that dish in seconds. Only a handful of pieces. These dishes are really not worth $18 each. I felt bad taking my friend here. I could tell he was not happy having to pay so much for this meal. This whole restaurant only has ONE restroom. Must be a nightmare during rush hour meal times.

Really nice Italian restaurant that's away from the chaos of Columbus St in North Beach. Enjoyed some burrata and meatballs as an appetizer. Both were great. The meatballs were dense but not tough nice flavor and the homemade sauce was done well. I went with the popular Carlesimo which features house-made rigatoncelli pancetta porcini peas sun-dried tomatoes spicy tomato cream. It was tasty and I was not disappointed. My girlfriend got their pasta special of the night which also had house-made pasta shrimp and a lemon wine sauce. She enjoyed it but noted that the shrimp were overcooked. Not egregiously so but definitely noticeable. While my heart likes this place more than 3 stars I could only logically provide 3 considering the more-than-lengthy wait in between appetizer and entree overcooked shrimp and the simple fact that I wasn't blown away by my entree as I anticipated. A great experience for sure and a place worth checking out.

Awesome local find in a slightly hilly and pleasant neighborhood. Eat great homemade pasta and watch the trolley roll by. Start with the antipasta meat and olive dish. Don't miss the pesto ravioli it was perfect I'm still thinking about that. And end with their homemade tiramisu gosh that's good. Compliment with a bottle of Chianti (any on the menu will be good) and you are set. I prefer to eat family style here so everyone can try all the wonderful dishes. Only rule: everyone must order something different.

Four and three-quarters stars for this great spot! Service: Spot on. Five stars. Atmopshere: A place to have good impassioned conversations and dinner with your friends. Not quiet but not too loud. Five stars. The Food: The salads and appetizers were very tasty. The bell peppers are famous and so delicious and rich. The salad with beets was a healthy portion size. The Carlesimo is one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had and there was a lot. The pasta is al dente and has a great texture that feels homemade. The sauce and toppings are fantastic. I will definitely order it again next time! The Pavarotti was not my style of flavor for pasta - and the pasta wasn't as nice as the Carlesimo. The Veal Saltimbocca was delicious! (poor baby cows...) The wine sauce was delicious the spinach was cooked well and the potatoes were satisfactory. The best spumoni I've ever had. One of the best tiramisu's I've ever had. The Drinks: The wine list is great and the cocktails are made well. I highly recommend this North Beach / Russian Hill gem.
I'm a local and this is my favorite spot in North Beach. I've been going for 10 years now. You can never go wrong with the Carlesimo and Burrata to start. Stop reading and go to Trattoria Contadina!
