text: Love coming here for the gnocchi! They took the Gorgonzola gnocchi off the menu. But when the waiter saw how disappointed I was he had the chef make it for me anyway!!!!!! Love the food here love the service!
Great old italian restaurant ambiance. The food is old style too.

With very limited experience with this regions food I let my date order for us and I was pleasantly surprised. The Pros: We started with prosciutto wrapped asparagus and oh my god it was off the hook a must have if you like asparagus. It was rich flavorful and nearly a mean all in itself. Then it was on to the breadcrumb stuffed and fried artichokes. They were alright but a bit heavy on anchovies. Shortly thereafter the main dishes were served. I decided on the Vongole. The sauce was perfect very flavorful but not overpowering. Had the clams been a bit better quality this dish would have been perfect. The wine was delicious as well. The Cons: The place was packed and pretty small. At first a waitress told us to take a seat upstairs and when we did another waitress told us she was about to close it for the evening. Once downstairs we were seated in pretty much the only available table in the place which was jammed in a corner where the door and window were for all who walk by to see us. The service was not the best for several reasons. We had to ask for our wine twice as well as any water refills but I'll chalk it up to the place being busy. If you want top of the line authentic Italian dishes with a cozy setting don't miss out on this place. The food was unforgettable.
Delicious food great ambiance and wonderful staff.

I was in search of an authentic Italian restaurant in Little Italy that wasn't touristy. Trattoria Contadina ended up being exactly what I was looking for! The restaurant felt so warm yet peaceful and our server was incredibly welcoming. At first I was totally overwhelmed by the entrees listed on the menu - I didn't recognize half of the Italian dishes! But our server helped us navigate thru it and made great recommendations. I ended up with the dinner special and my husband ordered Carlesimo. Everything tasted so fresh and comforting. The food was wonderful but the cozy atmosphere really made the biggest impact to me. It's the perfect place for an intimate meal with the person you love.

Whoa! Put me upstairs window seat bring the appetizers. Meatballs and buratta. Three tasty meatballs in a light and flavorful red sauce. The burrata was served with pancetta and greens. Very good! Btw Trattoria Contadina was exactly what I was looking for. A quaint local Italian restaurant with delicate flavors and a comfortable vibe. Our server was friendly helpful and had a a cool attitude. He really seemed like there was nowhere else he would rather be. Main courses - picatta red snapper and pavarotti. Both very good. Everyone around us looked really happy with their food. KQ... Thanks for the recommendation!
Why go through all the hustle and bustle right on Columbus? This place is a knockout. Great atmosphere cozy and authentic. Enjoy!

Trattoria Contadina was just fine. I've had better Italian food and better Italian food in the city. Their wine selection is awesome and for those that aren't as into Italian wines (like me) there are other regions to choose from as well. They have by the glass as well as by the bottle. We had the carpaccio the cesar salad frutti di mare spaghetti and meatballs and the ravioli. I ate the frutti di mare and it was a lot of food compared to my buddies. The shrimp and calimari were a little overdone but the mussels and clams were tasty. It was an average experience but I probably wouldn't go back. The good: good selection of food. Primi and secondi. The bad: limited seating make a reservation.
Although the restaurant seems a bit dark downstairs I was surprise there was a upstairs. The food was delicious and filling. Fantastic Italian food.

Wanted to try something new in Little Italy. Loved the past two experiences last time i was in the bay that I figured any place in Little Italy should be just as great as the other This restaurant was located slightly higher and a bit more isolated than the other restaurants but we (friends and I) found it! We walked in slowly into the tiny restaurant. Good thing it wasn't busy yet. Of course when in Little Italy one must order pasta!!! I ordered the vongole which has clams and it wasn't bad. It wasn't the best pasta I've had; I've had better in that areabut it also wasn't awful. The Pavarotti (circa 1984) was good there were lots of tastes going on so I enjoyed that one. However I think my favorite has to be the Salvatore; it was pretty hearty but really delicious as well. The server suggested it to my friend and we all tried his and I really liked it. I would come back here once I have tried all the restaurants in this area. I can't resist pasta!!

Great spot for an Italian dinner in North Beach! My husband and I really enjoyed our experience here. We had Jesus as our server who was very attentive and recommended an excellent red wine. Our favorite dish was the gnocchi with a tomato cream sauce.

Prior to an evening of Beach Blanket Babylon laughter my wife and I made a reservation at this wonderful restaurant through a Google and Yelp search. My wife selected this gem and the two of us just wishing for a an evening of delicious Italian food found our mecca. The service was sweet the food was impeccable the libations tasty and the ambiance was like I was sitting in my own living room with many guests. The atmosphere was very relaxing. I had the spaghetti special with homemade egg noodles shrimp and scallops in a white sauce. It was very tasty and so delightful. I highly recommend this little gem in North Beach. I could have sat there all night eating Italian food sipping wine having conversation with my bride and watching the cable car whisk by!

Came here for my post courthouse wedding dinner with my family. They were able to accomodate for our party comfortably. The wait staff was very attentive and patient with our party of 10. Everyone enjoyed their authentic Italian dinner. I was in love with my pesto pasta with green beans and my husband got the veal dinner which he loved a lot. Overall I would come back to this place for a good Italian meal. It was a little pricey but that was expected for the area and meal.

I love learning about the places that warm my heart. I've walked past the establishment a few times up the hill on Mason not really paying much attention to it. Another Italian restaurant in North Beach. There are a lot of those lined up on Columbus street -- very touristy and not really my style. Trattoria surprise us at first with their brunch. We walked in on a Sunday many months ago. Delicious with the impressions and flavors of a home cooked meals the best olive oils cheese and Italian wine you can find at affordable prices. There's more -- this place has been a North Beach favorite by many of the local Italian residents for over 10 years. It is a family owned business now managed by the second generation and his wife. They met while both working at the restaurant many years ago. My recommendation: just go!

My friend was visiting from New York and wanted to try Italian. Looked up some places on yelp found this place. The place itself is cosy and homey. Our waitress was really nice and attentive. The bread basket was not that great the bread was a little hard and tasted old. We each had a couple of drinks I had grapefruit cocktail my friends had prosecco old fashioned and manhattans which they all enjoyed. For appetizers we ordered the meatballs bruschetta and the antipasti. All of it was really good. For entree I had the gnocchi with chicken breast which was really good. My friend had the Fruiti di Mare which he loved and so did I. Another friend had the calamari steak which he raved about. And my friend visiting from New York had the Pavarotti without prosciutto and she did not like her dish very much it was pretty bland. We did end the night with a slice of tiramisu which was amazing will be back to try other options.

We wanted to love this place. The reservation was easy to make but when we showed up our table wasn't ready. We ordered antipasti pasta and secondi and our waitress was thoughtful enough to recommend 1/2 portions of the pasta since it was a lot of food. We ordered drinks but then they were out of raspberry syrup. We ordered coca cola but then it was flat. We ordered the saltimbocca but then they ran out of potatoes. The saltimbocca also had a bit too much rosemary (maybe another spice?) so it overpowered the entire dish. Probably just an off night.

I can't. I just can't deal! I mean... Wow. This is just the place you want to go to when you want the real deal. Period. You want fake or real Italian? If it's real and authentic Italian you want... Look no further. I came across this little piece of heaven when I was on the hunt for the best Italian around town. The reviews and pictures really caught my attention. I made reservations for 9 pm. Got there 15 minutes early and were seated within a few minutes. Super small cute and cozy place that added to the experience. What we ordered: Drinks: 1 bottle of Brunelo Di Montalcino Appetizers: Meatballs (3 to 1 order) Burrata Main course: Ravioli assortiti (beef) w/ Alfredo sauce Carlesimo Starting off with the bread. Yum. They bring oil and vinegar and I asked for a side of Parmesan cheese. Duh. I'm obsessed with cheese. I mean. I couldn't stop eating bread! Then the meatballs and burrata came. -_- just stop it right there. Meatballs: ON POINT! Fluffy and flavorful. Possible? It happened. So good! Flavors were all there. We almost ordered another plate of meatballs but really wanted to leave room for the entree. The burrata.... Ok... How do I explain it... There are no words! It had some kind of sliced meat (prosciutto?) under with the burrata on top and pesto on top of the burrata. That combination was just perfect. It melted in your mouth. There were four pieces. It was just perfect. Can't go wrong with either appetizer!! I ordered the ravioli and my boyfriend ordered the Carlesimo. Both of those particular pastas are made in house which is exactly what I wanted. Made from scratch pasta. And that's what I got. My ravioli's were great. It had a hint of some sort of sweetness to it which I didn't love because I personally don't like my food sweet unless it's dessert! My boyfriend didn't think it was but his palette is different. His pasta dish was just amazing. All the different ingredients came together to make every bite better than the last. The sun dried tomatoes and mushrooms were my favorite part of the dish. Overall: would I recommend? Absolutely. No doubt about that! Would I come back? Yes! I would recommend eating light in the day and planning on going to the gym the best day but certainly worth it. They definitely filled my Italian food fix I was in search of! Our total for the bill was $121 before tip. Not bad. We got a bottle of $55 wine 2 appetizers and 2 entrees.

Awesome pasta off the main strip in North Beach/Russian Hill! Try the eggplant rigatoni and the broccolini side. Simple and yummy- We sat at the bar and had a glass of wine with our food. The staff were so nice and they must have asked at least ten times if we were OK or if we wanted anything else. Really attentive and made us feel at home-
Brilliant food amazing wait staff tables are close together to inspire some friendly back and forth between diners. Great pastas!

My son and I stopped in on a recent Friday night as we were touring the city. We were seated upstairs right away. Cozy atmosphere and everybody was very friendly and prompt. Our server Jesus was quick very friendly and professional. The place was busy but we were not rushed or overlooked at all. I had the Pavorotti 1984 vegetables and cream sauce. My sons gnocchi was probably the best we've had. Same family owners for 30 years- they are definitely doing everything right! Prices were moderate too. We would certainly visit again when in town!

Trattoria Contadina is one of the better examples of the neighborhood italian restaurant in San Francisco that I've been to. We were there on a double date and we were all very pleased. The service was very good and very accommodating. We had brought a bottle of wine and after looking at their menu I noticed I couldn't find a corkage fee listed. We neglected to ask and just see what it was at the end of the meal once we received the bill. Our dinner was fairly expensive but nothing surprising. Because of that maybe they were content with not charging us a corkage fee? In any case it was very well appreciated! The food was all very good. It wasn't something that I would rant and rave about but I was very pleased with my dinner as was the rest of our group. Good flavors and a wide range of options on the menu. I would go back again for sure and it's nice to be away from the big touristy Italian places on Columbus and in the heart of the NB neighborhood.

I had high hopes for this place. I am tired of the generic touristy Italian places in North Beach; so when this place was recommended by a co-worker I thought that this could be our "go-to" spot for all things Italian. Sadly that wasn't the case for me. To me spaghetti and meatballs is the ultimate comfort food. When I saw it on their menu I had to try it. Sadly it was a major let down. The meatballs were so dry I couldn't eat the rest of it. My boyfriend had the Valdostana (chicken dish) which he said was pretty good. We both had a Caesar salad which was good but certainly forgettable. If an Italian restaurant can't even make decent meatballs what's there to say about their other dishes? It's possible that I had a bad batch of meatballs so I'm willing to give it another try at some point.
The first time we ate there it was because we stayed nearby during a week-long vacation. The second third and fourth time was because it was that good!
I'm not usually a pasta girl but that Carlesimo got me rethinking. Perfect spot for a relaxing 2 hour dinner!

I've been wanting to try this neighborhood place for a while. Really cute place. Small. Has an up stairs but downstairs is so nice with the Huge windows. You can watch the cable cars! It's a cozy restaurant & the service was great. We ordered for starters a Cesar salad. Too much dressing. We also ordered the Bruschetta. It was okay. Not great. We ordered the Vongole. It wad good. Had lots of fresh Manila clams in it. My son had the Sea food pasta which he liked. The food was just fine. It wasn't great.

Most of the Italian restaurants in North Beach are located along the Columbus Avenue corridor. Located in the outskirts amongst residential buildings at the corner of Union and Mason streets is Trattoria Contadina. With 6:00 reservations we checked in with the hostess were promptly seated at our choice of tables of two near the back of the dining room. A bar is located near the front and there are some tables in the front with a view of the cable cars going by and there are tables in the middle and back. They also have a seating area of about four table in a back upper level. Our waiter took our drink order before coming back to take our order. Since we had reservations for a show and short on time we opted to skip appetizers and just have entrées. After answering some questions regarding the dishes we placed our orders which came piping hot within ten minutes. House bread - with extra virgin olive. Balsamic vinegar was on the table for you to add into the oil. (yelp.com/biz_photos/trat…) Vincenzo - fettuccine with Little City sausage peppers onions olives in tomato sauce. The olives provided a nice balance to the red sauce. The dish had a good amount of sausage in it. (yelp.com/biz_photos/trat…) Correnti - farfalle with porcini chicken peas in a cream sauce. The chicken was tender in a tasty mushroom sauce. (yelp.com/biz_photos/trat…) A nice small cozy neighborhood restaurant. We were only able to try the pasta dishes and the two we had were delicious. Service was friendly and efficient.

Excellent food and service. Although I had to wait a while for my table I had a reservation but had to wait anyway. Wasn't that bad but I was not expecting for it. They have excellent wines and the food is really well done. For a date though I would not recommend. Because is a small place and the kitchen is open the food's smell will be on your clothes for the rest of the night.

I can be so pathetically myopic sometimes like presuming the only worthwhile eats in North Beach are on Columbus or Green or maybe Grant if I'm feeling more energetic. Going to any other block requires me to "think outside the box" and I'm the type who worries too much about what I'm missing inside the box. Lemme inside the box... PLEASE!! Thank goodness someone was kind enough to drill a big enough hole in my box to let me out. But enough with the Container Store analogies since four of us came here to dine on traditional Italiano off the tourist track in the residential area at Mason and Union. If you want good eats for hearty appetites they got 'em right here. Ba da bing ba da boom. So I came here with my friends Stephanie Robbie and his lovely wife Betsy all fairly recent transplanters to our fair city from points east and south. Yet the irony was that they already knew this place was a find while I the supposed expert on local eats was in the dark probably overly focused on the latest eatery to show up in 7x7. This one's been around since I put mousse in my hair and wanted to be in a Duran Duran cover band. It definitely looks like it was decorated back then but in a very simple back-to-basics way (photo: bit.ly/Nda7iH). No velvet paintings of clowns steering gondolas no lava lamps. Just classic. I started with one of their $8 signature Negronis because I needed it (photo: bit.ly/1eVtgM9). And it did the trick. You could bend me like a pretzel for the rest of the evening now especially with a chaser like a glass of the 2011 Brunelli Rosso di Montalcino a lively sangiovese with a fruity finish (photo: bit.ly/1eVtmDf). OK time to eat. I started with the $9 Insalata Barbabietola a festive plate of arugula radicchio beets goat cheese and pistachios all of it doused in a light vinaigrette that didn't need much coaxing to bring out the flavor (photo: bit.ly/Od0mlN). It was delicious and devoured in all-too-common haste. My entree was the most extravagant pasta dish on the menu the $25 Fruiti di Mare a nicely portioned plate of spaghetti saturated with clams mussels calamari red snapper scallops prawns onions and peperoncini all of it lightly tossed in a fresh tomato sauce (photo: bit.ly/1l0hybn). Just the type of seafood extravaganza I wanted to enjoy with relish. Not pickle relish I mean gusto. Good stuff nothing artful but pretty darn tasty and filling. But who doesn't want to share in a little dolci to cleanse the palate. The four of us shared two of the $7 specialty ice cream pies - a slice of the Mocha Fango layers of fudge and and mocha almond chip gelato on an Oreo cookie crust blended with chocolate chip and almonds and a slice of the Spumoni a Neapolitan combination of vanilla chocolate pistachio and strawberry ice cream - both drizzled in a dark chocolate sauce (photo: bit.ly/1feWwU8). And did I mention the $8 mug of Irish Coffee with Jameson whiskey and a whopping dollop of whipped cream (photo: bit.ly/1feWDyW). Delicioso. Heavens to Betsy. Oh wait she's here...and most heavenly. FOOD - 4 stars...good old-fashioned Italian well executed with no frills AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...classically nondescript with nary a red checkerboard tablecloth in sight SERVICE - 3.5 stars...not too intrusive though a bit on rote TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely for those tired of inhaling the gas fumes at the sidewalk tables on Columbus

A truly "cantina Italiana" where you can taste a good Italian wine or beer and eat nice Italian food. A "small" place with real Italian spirit! Highly recommended! Also beautiful view of Mason Street. Certainly a place to come back!

We are visiting and went for dinner with our 5 and 7 year olds. Amazing is all I can say! Food service pricing ambience! We has Burrata salad and meatballs to start with an incredible bottle of wine by Nancy's recommendation. Followed by veal for my husband and I had the spaghetti al'merica(?) I know I said that wrong...it was second choice under pasta; best pasta I've ever had! Go here you won't regret it! I spent more on lunch at the wharf and the food wasn't good! (Lou's Fish Shack). This place is a gem go and you'll see why;)

Just went here last night and although the service was great the food leaves much to be desired. To start off the olive oil/balsamic they provide with bread in the beginning of the meal is extremely low quality. It's not worth eating at all butter would have been better. We ordered gnocchi to start with the sauce was good but the gnocchi was very tough. We had the lamb for the main course and it was HIGHLY under seasoned. Actually I don't think the cooks used any salt and pepper before preparing it. We had to use table salt and pepper and it was still crappy. I have never had to salt and pepper my own food at a restaurant! This was the worst lambs chops I have ever had in my life. I am very surprised to see so many positive reviews for this place this has got to be the first time ever that I've disagreed with Yelp.

Treated a friend out to dinner restaurant was way smaller/cozier than the pics showed parking was pretty crazy parked in a lot around the corner for $20. Bruschetta was ok I have had better but it wasn't bad. My friend got the Caprese salad and that was really delicious! For an entrée I got the chicken with gnocchi and mushrooms really really good. For dessert we both got the stratiacella gewhich was divine. Service was quick and atmosphere was lively kind of loud actually but fun. Would for sure go back for another special occasion. Prices were a little steep but I felt the quality of the food was also up there.

The food here is excellent! These people know how to make Italian food! I had the vodka tonic made from homemade tonic and I'm thinking what could be so special in homemade tonic. This was one delicious cocktail you got to try because it tastes nothing like a vodka tonic you would order at a bar or lounge. The Carlesimo pasta and the Veal Parmigiana was cooked perfectly and tasted like the food I had in Italy. They do get extremely busy so call ahead to get a table. We tried to get a reservation two weeks ago and they were booked up till the late evening. The server told us that they will get even busier with the warm months coming up. I can't wait to go back to try other dishes at this restaurant!

I wish it were better. I wanted to leave so happy and so satisfied but it wasn't quite so. The piccata (red snapper) in lemon-butter-white wine sauce was flavorful for sure but the fish was definitely on the over cooked size. The potatoes with the dish was quite good but only somewhat warm. The spinach cooked down with garlic was somewhat bland. Ricotta gnocchi met neither of our expectations. More solid than we expected some how it got a little better as the sauce cooled and thickened. It was somewhat 'meh'. The restaurant is definitely loud even though there is a decent amount of space between the tables we didn't enjoy having to speak up to talk to each other. The bar was intriguing as was the cocktail list but this is a place you'd go with food as a priority drinks second and with the abundance of fabulous Italian eateries in the city I can't justify a return trip.

Stumbled upon this place as I was trying to look for a place for a late dinner. We decided to go here since it was one of the few restaurants that was still quite packed at 10pm. And glad we ended up here. Service was great food was delicious! What more can you ask for? We ordered mostly the off the daily specials menu and that was a smart decision. The beef carpaccio was decent but nothing too amazing. The seared scallops appetizer was seared perfectly and the sauce was the perfect accompaniment. It came with 4 medium sized scallops. The crab pasta in tomato sauce was delicious. There was plenty of crab meat in the sauce and the pasta was cooked to a perfect al dente. The stuffed pork chops was filled with ooey gooey cheese and proscuitto and glazed with a balsamic reduction to cut some of the heaviness of the cheese. So yummy! Service: Our waiter was super friendly and our water glasses were constantly filled. Even though they were busy we were checked up on several occasions to make sure everything was going well. And there were a couple of birthdays that night in the restaurant so all the waiters sang happy birthday in italian.

My company had a reserved four-course meal here and lemme tell you every single damn course was DELICIOUS. 1st: Bruschetta Insalata Caprese and Arancia e Finocchio - these were laid out across the table for all of us to share so I got to taste all of them. Every single one was fantastic but I gotta say the Insalata Caprese was the best. Mmm fresh mozzarella... 2nd: Appetizer I chose the Paccheri Golosi out of three options and it was a great choice. The tube pasta was cooked just right - just firm enough to please my soul but not rock hard. I knew there was still the main course and dessert left though so I didn't finish sadly. Woulda if I coulda. 3rd: For the main I got the Scallopine di Vitello al Tartufo veal scallopine in a black truffle sauce and I can hands down say it was one of my favorite dinners in my entire life. I liked every single thing on the dish which I don't normally say for a dish - I usually just like 2 out of 3 parts or something. But the veal was phenomenal the mashed potatoes and spinach on the side was phenomenal and the sauce laid out beautifully went with every single part of the dish (veal spinach mashed potatoes). It was just... perfection. 4th: Dessert I think I got Tiramisu. Twas Tiramisu which I always enjoy but didn't blow my mind like the other dishes. tl:dr - I love dis place.

It's always a little unnerving to decide where to go eat in North Beach. There are just so many restaurants... but I've been here twice and have always really enjoyed the service and the food. This time I had the squid ink pasta... not as good as I remembered it (it was a tad bit salty) but my fiance's pork saltimbocca was delicious. I love the beef carpaccio - so tasty and rich. The wine suggestions were very nice and the service was what you would imagine if you were in Italy - very charming and boisterous but attentive.

Aunthentic Italian food located in the heart of Little Italy in San Francisco. Very busy place on a weekend. Service was helpful and kind. The food was not all that great. We came here because we were looking for a place to eat. As always we yelped nearby places and came here because of the reviews. Totally dissapointed my friend and I got sick from the pizza for the next three days :(

Mangia! Mangia! As we walked in we were greeted immediately with smiles. We noticed the restaurant was filled with groups of different sizes and mostly families. It felt like going to grandma's house and she couldn't wait to feed you. We were glad to get a table on the loft because downstairs was louder and more hectic. On our way to sitting down at least three other employees welcomed us with enthusiasm. Really cool! Since it was our first visit we were not familiar with their menu. So our waiter explained the dishes to us and made a couple of suggestions the whole time without rushing even though he was clearly busy. In fact all the workers were constantly moving and serving customers but stayed polite and pleasant. Our food arrived quickly. The first appetizer was Pere e Prosciutto - pears wrapped in mascarpone and Italian ham. The vinegar drizzle made it interesting and the whole ensemble worked well. Carpaccio di Polpo was refreshing with the lemon dressing olives and capers. The octopus was sliced to paper thin and could have used a little less olive oil. It was still a good dish. Spaghetti Neri (squid ink pasta) was cooked in a garlic and white wine sauce. They were generous with the seafood. My wife really enjoyed this. I was happy with mine too. I picked Involtino di Pollo. The chicken breast was stuffed with prosciutto fontina cheese and spinach. It was delicious and nicely presented. As if we weren't full already desserts had yet to come. The strawberry sauce and chocolate-hazelnut sauce on the Panna Cotta was great. Tiramisu all'Arancia had Grand Marnier which was very light and simply yum. I couldn't decide which I liked more. Both were awesome changes of pace for us. The ambiance and the high decibel of this place naturally fits the family and group scene; but not so much for a romantic evening with your significant other. In here talking loud and using big gestures almost seems expected. I loved it! The whole setting of the place and the friendliness of the people! Just set your expectations accordingly and you'll have a good time. Ti voglio bene E Tutto Qua!

This place is fantastic! It's really great Italian food and the bustling ambiance is really fun. We always get a pizza as the appetizer. The pizza is amazing. It's ultra thin and crispy. Not east or west coast style not Neapolitan - Roman style like a cracker. Really great. I always get the tube pasta with the creamy porcini mushroom and pancetta sauce. We all share bites and it's always the best pasta at the table. Delicious. My bf always gets the lamb chops. I'm not a heavy meat eater so I don't get it. But he loves it. Unfortunately the place is a little loud and always packed. It's probably not the place go to have a quit conversation but it's great if you're having some drinks and want to get a little loud.
Great hospitality and service. Must get the Bruschetta one of the best I've tasted.

Dear Yelp can I have more stars? Five is just not enough for this place. Please see my calculations below: Wine selection - 5 stars Bruschetta - 5 stars Every single pasta dish - 10 stars Tiramisu - 10 stars Panna Cotta - 20 stars Staff - 100 stars See? It's legit I need more stars. ETQ is BELLISSIMO (I hope I'm using that correctly). Best Italian in SF BOOM.

This place was definitely crowded on a Friday night for dinner. Glad we made reservations and they also ended up opening the upstairs. The staff were all super friendly and nice so it makes the dining experience more fun! We ended up ordering the salad ETQ Piccheri ripieni and spaghetti Neri. The salad was a good start as it was light and fresh with a house dressing (I'm assuming olive oil). In addition I've been a fan of squid ink pasta since I've had it a year ago in Cabo so I knew this was the dish I had to order. ETQ's squid ink put the one in Cabo I had to shame! The pasta was cooked nicely al dente and the pasta sauce was super light. Probably one of my lightest meals I ate in San Fran. So enjoyable that I'm still thinking about it. My fiancé Piccheri pasta was good as well but it was a lot more heavy. The sauce was the best part of the dish as his pasta was undercooked. I loved that our waiter told us to use our bread to soak up all the extra sauce cuz that was delicious! Too bad I was so full to order any dessert. I'm always a fan of tiramisu and would have loved to try theirs! Overall great recommendation from a friend.
So great. So loud. So yummy. Homemade pasta that morning. Homemade bread. Waiters yelling in Italian to each other. I loved every second of it! :)
Food was great service excellent. The place can get a little loud but that is because everyone is having so much fun. We ordered scallops and pasta. Overall great experience.
Such a great experience for a few Southern girls. Charming staff and authentic Italian! Great prices as well. Very impressed and highly recommend!

What can I say about this place other than "Ciao!" You want almost authentic Italian Italian food served by FOB Italian waiters? Come to E Tutto Qua! There's something incredibly quaint when you are eating ok Italian food served by the high energy and LOUD waiters. It makes me give allowances for their food and in my instance long wait time for my dinner (took 45 mins for us to get our plates). Here's my review: Staff - Mostly native Italian loud animated and perfectly heavenly! They were very polite and even suggested against adding shaved parmesan on my entree because it would take away from the flavor. Restaurant - packed packed and packed by tourists. I made the mistake of coming here off the recommendation of a native SF...I was a tourist but didn't want to be surrounded by them. Food - 3 stars at best. Stale bread overly drenched salad dressing and overly cooked noodles. Overall it was a good experience.

It is a modest Italian restaurant on the corner of Broadway and Columbus! It is hard to not notice this restaurant when walking by or driving by this restaurant because it is right at the corner of inter-traffic! This place has great ambiance with modern decor inside and intricate exterior. Their squid ink was quite commendable and their rack of lamb was made with tender perfection! Their Gnocchi was nicely cooked. It is quite pricey however. That would be the only downside but do keep in mind that you are paying for the decorationssurrounding as well as the gourmet food! The staff team are actually Italian speakers - authentic and impressive I would say.

My family came here for a goodbye dinner for my brother [before he goes back to college] and had a great time! The waiters are actually Italian so it's pretty awesome hearing them communicate with each other. They're really enthusiastic & helpful. I was impressed especially since we had a party of 10. We started off with wine & appetizers - the prosciutto crostini & burrata were SO good. Oh man. The fritto misto was also good - not super greasy. I got to try some of my boy's seafood gnocchi [bomb] and my brother's seafood fettucini and they were so good! I think they brought out the wrong pizza for me but it's okay.. I love thin crust pizza and the flavors were really good. Dessert was pretty good too. The mango gelato was really good [so flavorful] but I think the strawberry one was too sweet. I also had some of the chocolate profiteroles - SO good but really rich. Portions are really large - we had so many leftovers but I mean that's never really a bad thing haha.
Great experience! Loved the staff and atmosphere they make you feel like your really in Italy. The food was amazing and loved the location. You won't be disappointed !

Loved it! We ordered the ricotta and spinach ravioli's pizza and the bruschetta as an appetizer everything was delicious. You can taste how fresh the ingredients are and although you only get like 6 large raviolis there were still pretty filling the pizza was a pretty big plus you still get delicious warm free bread when you first sit down. If you're looking for a nice experience of good italian mixed with a fun experience this is the place. The energy was vibrant to say the lease and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

For my 3rd visit here I made a reservation for our large party of 8 about 2 weeks in advance. You can imagine I was more than slightly irritated when we still had to wait close to an hour for our table. Luckily my group found the bar and patently waited. The staff was sympathetic and explained that the table they had in mind for us was taking an abnormally long time to leave. After the painful wait our experience was nothing but wonderful as it has been the past few times I've visited. The staff is FABULOUS! I wish I had a fraction of their energy... Our table ordered a plethora of dishes. Highlights included: appetizers Carpaccio di Manzo Insalata Caprese entrees Ravioli alla Fiorentina Fettuccine Tricolore Tonnarelli di Mare Finally the manager and server came by and gave our table two desserts on the house to compensate for our long wait times. This was greatly appreciated by our table! The food is excellent and the staff is even better. I sincerely enjoy taking out of town guests here for the experience....really the staff is seriously entertaining ;)

Looking for a new adventure in North Beach and searching Yelp for our next encounter. We found Tutto Qua but our foodie adventure has really expanded our waistline. So looking for smaller portions. Tutto Quo is our place. We walked in and this place has so much energy. Very loud. People enjoying their meals and the servers were loud and friendly. All the servers seemed like they speak Italian with English as a second language. So we were started off with their freshly baked bread. So soft in the middle and good. Really good bread but you got to watch yourself cause you won't be able to eat your dinner. My wife and daughter were splitting a meal and salad. They started off with the Insalata Tutto Qua salad. It had pear endive mixed greens and gorgonzola with a house dressing. They loved it. Incredible. Tasty. They then split the Mezzi Rigatoni Alla Norcina with homemade pasta Italian sausage and mushrooms in a cream sauce. Pasta was amazingly fresh. Sausage wasn't spicy and really good (I stole a bite). Amazingly good. I had the Gnocchi Allo Zafferano. It had fresh handmade gnocchi with zucchini tomatoes and fresh clams in their shells. Gnocchi were so fresh and cooked perfectly. Clams were great. It had a nice kick to it. Very very good. My son had one of their daily specials of Linguine with clams cherry tomatoes and mushrooms. Really good and tasty. He was really happy with it. We didn't have a chance to taste their desserts cause we were stuffed Foodies. Service was outstanding. Always filling up our water cups checking on our food and cleaning our plates off. Really enjoyed the meal and service. Very Italian. Only bad thing is we were upstairs and it was a little hot but I understand SF. They don't have air conditioning. So if your looking for a real Italian experience then this is the place for you. Enjoy

Excellent service throughout our meal. Quality Italian food. The outside seating is a bit noisy. Good selection of wine. The cold octopus dish could use more octopus. Their endive salad could use more endive. We'll be back.

This place is fantastic. Good food good service lots of seating. I called to make a reservation on a Saturday night about 2 hours before I wanted to arrive and I was surprised to be accommodated. When I arrived my party of four waited about 15 minutes for our table to be cleaned up. We saw several tables of 10+ people having a rowdy good time. The place is loud but festive. The waiters are all yelling at each other in Italian providing some authentic atmosphere. Our waiter was busy but attentive answering all of our questions. I wanted something light so I ordered the anchovies. The plate comes with three anchovies that are about six inches long. It was crispy yummy and fishy and I was surprised to be full. The husband got the paccheri golosi large tube pasta with mushrooms and truffle oil. The waiter declined his request to substitute the type of pasta since that shape is specifically paired for that sauce. It was just okay couldn't taste the truffle at all. My friends had the pappardelle al ragu and spaghetti neri (squid ink pasta) and both were delicious. The sauce in the pappardelle was very flavorful. The squid ink pasta was really good and came with a lot of seafood. We shared the beef carpaccio it was quite good but not mind blowing. Portions are just right not stuff-yourself-silly like other Italian places. We received a complimentary tiramisu since our table was near the bar and the waiters kept having to squeeze past us to get to the kitchen. Food service atmosphere was all A+. I will definitely be back.

The entrée (black cod) was very good. But the service was extremely slow (we were there for 2 hours) and the pizza was not really one of the best as we expected. The calamari was extremely pedestrian.

We got the burratta and the eggplant with meatball appetizers. The burratta was ok. The waiter claimed they fly it in from Italy everyday. I just had amazing buratta in Monterey at il veccio two days ago so compared to that I was a little disappointed. Delfina also has much better buratta. We split a pasta dish. It was not good. I don't even know how to describe it. I'm so depressed now. After you've had excellent Italian food elsewhere two days before it's so hard to lower yourself again.

My friends and I were trying to carb up for the marathon and found this place via Yelp. We didn't have reservations and had a party of 8. They weren't sure if they could take us because of the amount of reservations they already had but they gladly squeezed us in! The staff is very upbeat. They were singing and dancing while serving their guests. I could listen to them talk in Italian all day long!! Their house bread is so good!! I think we finished about three baskets!! My boyfriend and I ordered the Insalata E Tutto Qua and fettuccine Salmon. Both were delicious. He didn't leave anything on his plate because the creamy sauce on his pasta was so good. I'm glad we stumbled onto this place while in SF! Would definitely come back if were in town again!

The service and the appetizer were good but the main course was nothing special and extremely overpriced. Definitely not worth it. There are MUCH better places all over columbus street with authentic and much better italian food.

Great place. Quaint nicely decorated in a typical Italian style. Food was delicious. They had a special mozzarella salad with warm tomatoes that was amazing. Plus the gnocchi with tomato sauce was to die for. Pillowy bites of heaven. Highly recommend. I'll be visiting again next time in I'm in town.

Not the....classiest area of North Beach but this is a wonderful place to stop for a late night drink and dessert. It can be quite loud earlier on so I would try to sit in one of the nooks or along the windows when they are open (good people watching there too!). I have never actually had dinner here so I can't speak to the entrees but I come here for the panna cotta. It is delicious; you need to get it with half chocolate and half strawberry. Everyone who works here makes you feel like family and true to the Italian way they will not bring you the check until you ask for it (otherwise it would be rude like asking you to leave). There is also a Banksy on the wall above the restaurant. You can see it clearly from across the street. :)

Quite possibly the best Italian fare in San Francisco. My bestie comes here and raves about it her bestie does the same now it's my turn. ALWAYS order the scallop appetizer- a tremendous Mouth Gasm was had. Cooked to perfection possibly the tenderest scallops I've had in my life. The handsome man that took me here comes here often as there was no waiting for a table. Packed on a late Monday evening. He had a double crown on the rocks I had a woodford reserve old fashion. This pair nicely with the scallops. The gorgeous man I was with had something that wasn't even on the menu and insisted I had a pasta dish. The noodles here are crazy fresh and cooked perfectly al dente. My main course was a ground lamb in perfectly seasoned tomato sauce over noodles (see I couldn't even pronounce the name of the damn dish such a newb to Italian food. For dessert- do yourself a favor and order the Pannacotta you will not be disappointed. it was the perfect ending to that meal.One order was enough for the both of us. For a date it was a notch above the rest. I look forward to coming back!

Mama Mia! That was one deliciouso dinner!!! When taking to San Francisco your gaggle of girlfriends who have travelled from the Southern states dinner is to be had at "E' Tutto Qua!" for the North Beach experience. Such delicious food (yes worth repeating). Excellent service. Entertaining and charming servers. Care and attention. What more do we need? Our favorites: The scallops appetizer (must have been that nights' special...I don't see it on the Internet menu) Mezzi Rigatoni all Carbonara Spaghetti Neri Yum! Yum! Yum! Gentlemen: Thank you for a lovely evening. Our apologies for the un-lady-like conduct of we girls wrestling one another in an attempt to pay the bill. We will be back...often!!! And thank you to the Yelp* community for steering us here!!!
We traveled from SF Kansas City to Honolulu and the food at E' Tutto Qua was just wonderful! Thanks Stefan for the lovely service!
This place is so fun! Food was great and the entertainment was even better Love the singing waiters!
We were sent here by the W hotels concierge. They were able to seat a 7 top in 30 minutes. Service was a 10... Pleasant and fast. Food was an 8. Classic trattoria. Overall great experience.

By far my favorite Italian restaurant! The food here is amazing. You can't go wrong with anything you order. It gets really packed that sometimes you are still left waiting for a while despite having a reservation. If you want authentic Italian food then you must go here!

Delicious true Italian fare. From the moment you walk in you're family. Waiters are dancing clapping and having a good time. No pepperoni no spaghetti and meatballs. Italian pizza sans tomato sauce with prosciutto shaved Parmesan and arugula. Meat stuffed in noodles with a creamy sauce squid ink pasta with seafood NY steak with tomatoes arugula shaved mozzarella and potatoes salad with super light dressing... Had to wait despite reservations. Had to wait after sitting. But that's Italian in itself. Make it an event not just another meal. Go easy on the bread and save room... Three of us had 2 salads 3 entrees and a pizza.

My oh my! This happened to our second choice for DIne About Town and we had decided to go to Isa instead. But my friend decided to celebrate her birthday here the night before. And I'm happy to say that I was able to try it out. It would have been a shame if I had left SF without getting a meal from here. We were a very large group (10+) and they were very accommodative. Our wait staff was also very friendly and entertaining. There was so much wine flowing that half the dinner was a blur but I definitely remember the good food! I'd recommend the scallops and the swordfish. Both dishes were amazing. Thumbs up to the city of San Francisco.

Went to this place with the family last night. I read four stars and two dollar signs. In my opinion this should have been two stars and three dollar signs. Bruschetta appetizer was around $8 for tomatoes on top of bread that they serve for free. The Sausage and Mushroom Pizza was $17 for a super thin crust soggy pizza. Rest of our entrees were of the same price and caliber. Considering the food and the prices not sure why this place was so crowded. I took that as a sign that it must be good but that was not to be. That leads to my second complaint. This place was so noisy we couldn't carry a normal conversation. Now that I think about it maybe there was a groupon or yelp coupon that I missed?
I ate the best italian dishes i have ever had here. The best tomato sauce I have ever had too ever. No exaggeration.

E' Tutto Qua is great for birthdays! Tell the servers that it is someone's birthday and at the end of the meal the waiters will gather up and sing happy birthday and give a complimentary slice of tiramisu cake with a lighted candle! Definitely a lovely surprise for the birthday person :) Ambiance -- Clean spacious and has that fancy-formal feel without being too fancy. Like other reviews have said this place is LOUD. My boyfriend sat across from me and I had to ask him a couple times to repeat what he said because I couldn't hear over the noise. This wasn't a big issue but it might be if you prefer something more intimate and serene. E'Tutto Qua has a friendly and homey vibe within a charming restaurant. Service -- Young outgoing social and charming Italian male servers with Italian accents. They come over frequently to ask how you're doing and even give advice on the best ways to eat their food (ie. Don't add additional cheese in the pasta or it will detract from the flavor. Thank you!). Also when my boyfriend lost his glasses and we came back to the restaurant to find them the waiter not only helped us look for it but also asked several other waiters if they've seen them. Great service to say the least! Food -- Yum! Authentic Italian food with intense rich flavors. Thank you for not disappointing me. I'm so impressed! I'm use to "Italian" restaurants such as the Olive Garden Buca di Beppo and these chains do NOT even compare to an authentic place like E' Tutto Qua. If you think these chains tastes good or are authentic shame on you! They house-make their spaghetti here so it looks a little different (darker and more wiggly) but it tastes a lot better and is probably healthier too. The pizza is delivered as a whole pizza and is very thin but that allows you to experience the explosive rich flavors in a way that you can't with the typical overly-thick American pizzas. Try the mussels & clams in white wine sauce spaghetti with tomato sauce and pizza with tomato sauce. You won't be disappointed. Overall great food great ambiance and great service. Thank you.

I love Italian food and must try a place everywhere I travel. This place was solid. One thing was the customer service was a bit slow (water wait etc) if it wasn't for that and bad parking options I would have given it a four star! Thumbs up: -good food affordable prices -flavor profiles complimented one another -friendly staff -authentic Italian and staff speak the language of Thumbs down: -bad parking options -not so family friendly surrounded by nudey bars -slower service -loud Try the fritto app. ravoli and Truffle oil white sauce pasta dish all tasty bites! Would return when in area only with hubby.

Favorite Italian restaurant in north beach!! I've been here several times now and have always had an outstanding experience here! Great food great service cute cozy atmosphere. Try and snag a booth table. For appetizers: Loved the carpaccio with Parmesan arugula and capers. Another day tried the burrata with prosciutto--both wonderful. Entrees: The carbonara is to die for and made authentic Italian style. Some of my other favorite plates include the filet mignon the paccheri golosi with truffle oil and the gnocchi Gorgonzola that melts in your mouth. You really can't go wrong with their pastas. Check the specials too! My suggestion is if you're a party of two share an appetizer split a plate of pasta then have your meat afterward. Desserts: If you have room try more than one! Lovely chocolate soufflé heavenly panna cotta (try with strawberry and chocolate sauce) and I adore the zabaglione with strawberries. This is also a great place for birthdays too.
